definition: to run this way and that (idiom); to rush about busily/to bustle about/to hopscotch/also 東跑西顛|东跑西颠[dong1 pao3 xi1 dian1]
east/host (i.e. sitting on east side of guest)/landlord
surname Dong
to go to/to head for/towards
to hurry/to rush/to run quickly/to elope
the West/abbr. for Spain 西班牙[Xi1 ban1 ya2]/Spanish
west
to walk/to go/to run/to move (of vehicle)/to visit/to leave/to go away/to die (euph.)/from/through/away (in compound verbs, such as 撤走[che4 zou3])/to change (shape, form, meaning)

sentences.english: He hunted high and law for a job.
The purchasing agent rushes around every day to secure materials.
sentences.chinese: 採購員天天爲備料東奔西走。

sentences.english: Favor stillness over a buzz of activity.
sentences.chinese: 在東奔西走的活動中尋覓一份安寧。

sentences.english: He kicked around a good deal before settling down.
sentences.chinese: 他東奔西走了好一陣才定居下來。

sentences.english: I've run around the office all day. I'm exhausted!
sentences.chinese: 我一整天都在辦公室裏東奔西走，實在困極了。

sentences.english: With this kind of job, I am 'sways on the move.
sentences.chinese: 爲了這個就業，我每天東奔西走。

definition: lit. the duck is the first to know if the spring water is warm (idiom)/fig. an expert in the field knows which way the wind blows
pinyin: chun1 jiang1 shui3 nuan3 ya1 xian1 zhi1

definition: a falling leaf returns to the roots (idiom); everything has its ancestral home/In old age, an expatriate longs to return home.
(idiom) (of a good outcome) unanticipated/serendipitous/fortuitous
to bury oneself in work (idiom); to be engrossed in work/to make an all-out effort/up to the neck in work
lit. to return the jade annulus to Zhao (idiom); fig. to return something intact to its rightful owner
lit. one body two sides (idiom)/fig. a situation with two sides to it
a snap of the fingers (idiom); in an instant/in a short moment/in a flash/in the twinkling of an eye
the still of the night (idiom)/late at night
to get rid of the old to bring in the new (idiom); to innovate
as time goes by (idiom)
sighing voice, wailing breath (idiom)/to heave deep sighs/to sigh in despair
to decay/to decline/to become corrupt
to sell only for a good price (idiom)/to wait for a good offer
to run this way and that (idiom); to rush about busily/to bustle about
to spare no effort
lit. so loud that even the deaf can hear (idiom); rousing even the apathetic
